column4: hello, If I install ubuntu on a SCSI disk, then install the drive to another computer, will it boot?
if u install grub to that disk as well. then it should boot
on that computer u have to select this scsi disk as the boot device
If the target compputer is SMP, will that be a problem?
whats smp? i dont get it:-/
http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Symmetric_multiprocessing
the cpu's have nothing to do with the booting as long as the arch is correct like x86 or whatever...
its grub and your bios that has to support booting from your scsi device
ok, that's x86 right. My server is down, grub error 17, So I need to take a bootable disk to rescue it
did u try a livecd?
the worst part of that machine is, its IDE channel seems very faulty
does it support booting from usb? if yes try liveusb
I am pretty desperate cause it is a 10-year-old machine
hmmm...then ur only luck is a disk with ubuntu pre installed on it ..i guess
The data we're trying to rescue is a RAID 5 Volume
sorry then...can't help with that..
If thing gone worse, I might have to tear down the RAID volume, get another workstation to deal with
Just hope it will boot :D
thanks!
are u logged in?
are u using vino vncserver?..u need to login into the desktop to be able to use it
